meanings.definition: Not alike in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: The two houses on the street were unsimilar in size and color.
meanings.sent2: The unsimilar opinions of the group led to a lively discussion.
meanings.sent3: It was unsimilar to see a cat chasing a dog instead of the other way around.
meanings.sent4: The unsimilar weather patterns in the region puzzled the meteorologists.
meanings.sent5: The unsimilar tastes of the dishes made the dinner party memorable.

meanings.sent1: The two paintings were unsimilar in style and subject.
meanings.sent2: Her unsimilar approach to problem-solving often yielded creative solutions.
meanings.sent3: It was unsimilar to see a penguin in the desert instead of the icy Antarctic.
meanings.sent4: The unsimilar paths they took in life eventually led them back together.
meanings.sent5: The unsimilar melodies of the songs created a unique blend of music.
